description: Replace the existing boat ramp with a reinforced concrete ramp, including the installation of geotextile filter fabric, rip-rap, and rebar. The work also includes the demolition of the existing ramp and adjacent timber crib, removal and disposal of demolished materials, and site restoration. The contract includes mobilization and demobilization of equipment and all associated items.
full_summary:
### Botsford Harbour – Boat Ramp Replacement

**Project Reference:** cb-7693-69429567

**Request for Proposal:** Fisheries and Oceans is seeking proposals for the reconstruction of the existing boat launching ramp at Botsford public wharf located in Murray Corner, Westmorland County, New Brunswick.

**Scope of Work:**

The selected bidder will be responsible for furnishing all plant, labour, equipment, and materials necessary for the construction of a new reinforced concrete ramp, including:

* Demolition of the existing ramp and adjacent timber crib
* Removal and disposal of demolished materials
* Construction of a new ramp with excavation, geotextile filter fabric, rock fills, sub-base materials, and rip-rap
* Supply and installation of rebar, pre-cast concrete panels, and cast-in-place concrete
* Asphalt paving with new gravel and asphalt base and seal
* Site restoration and cleanup

**Contract Duration:**

The contract duration is expected to be completed by March 31, 2024.

**Bid Submission:**

The deadline for proposal submission is August 22, 2023, 2:00 p.m. (Eastern Daylight Time). Bidders must submit their proposals electronically through the Canada Buys website.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

Proposals will be evaluated on the basis of best value, considering factors such as price, quality, and timeliness of delivery.

**Important Note:**

This project is open to all bidders, but it will be conditionally set-aside under the Government of Canada’s Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more bids are received from Indigenous businesses certified under the PSIB criteria.

**Contact Information:**

Marie-France Chrétien
Procurement Officer
Fisheries and Oceans Canada
301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, New Brunswick E3C 2M6
 Phone: (450) 521-4448
